document_title: Whitmore disease (bacterial infection): Causes, symptoms, prevention
subsection_content:
Whitmore disease (Melioidosis) is an acute infectious disease. The disease has the scientific name Burkholderia pseudomallei - also the name of the bacteria that causes this deadly disease (people often call "Whitmore bacteria" after the name of its discoverer).
B.pseudomallei bacteria can be transmitted to humans and animals in contaminated water and soil environments.
Therefore, the disease often appears during the rainy season and is common in rural areas, where people are regularly exposed to mud, soil, dirty water sources... Not only humans, but also some animals such as pigs and horses. , dogs, cats, goats, cattle... can also be infected.
